FacilityName: DeBruce Ag Service, Inc., Benton NH3

_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Farm Product Raw Material Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
DeBruce Ag Services

Risk Management Plan-Executive Summary

1. DeBruce Ag Services (DBAS) accidental release prevention policy involves, but is not limited to technologies, procedures, and management practices.  All applicable procedures of the ANSI K-61.1-1989 ?Safe Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia?, as adopted by the Iowa Department of Agriculture and Land Stewardship (IDALS), are adhered to.  The DBAS emergency response policy involves the preparation of response plans, which are tailored to each facility and to the emergency response services available in the community, and is in compliance with the EPA Emergency Response Program requirements.


2.The DBAS facility at Benton is in the business of selling anhydrous ammonia to farm customers as a form of nitrogen fertilizer.  The facility has one anhydrous ammonia storage tank with the maximum capacity of 131,000 lbs. of anhydrous ammonia.  The   location includes anhydrous ammonia storage tanks, nurse tank filling risers, electrical panels, lighting, and anhydrous ammonia safety equipment.  The facility is manned year round during normal business hours.

3.DBAS?s accidental release prevention plan is based on the following key elements:
-Annual training of all personnel required to handle ammonia and what to do in an emergency
-Facilities constructed & maintained according to ANSI K 61.1-1989 standards adopted by IDALS in Iowa.
-Use of usual anhydrous ammonia safety equipment.
-Use of effective operating and safety procedures according to current standards.
-Annual inspections by IDALS of storage tanks, piping for leaks, nurse tanks, application equipment, transfer risers, riser hoses, safety equipment, pressure relief valve records, etc.
-The DBAS Safety Director will inspect this facility regularly and in conjunction with the Insurance Company experts or Regulatory Authorities.

4.No accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia have occurred at this facility in the past five years.

5

.This facility has an emergency response program, which has been coordinated with the Mt ayr Fire Department, which is member of Ringold County LEPC (Local Emergency Planning Committee) in Iowa.  This program includes response decision tree and a notification plan.  Emergency operations and response procedures are reviewed annually, with a site visit of the facility by the Fire Department.

6.Changes to improve safety at this facility are completed as required by rule change and/or methods to increase safety and/or efficiency of operations.
